medical_history.chief_complaint: The patient was evaluated for vomiting.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient began having frequent nonprojectile, nonbloody, nonbilious 'spit ups' at 26 days of age, which progressed to occasional emesis containing dark-brown material resembling blood by 14 months of age. Symptoms were aggravated after consumption of solid foods and less frequently after milk.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient has a history of feeding difficulties and insufficient weight gain. Previously suspected allergies to cow's milk protein and treatment for gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD) were noted.
medical_history.family_history: The patient's mother has anemia. The maternal aunt has hyperthyroidism; the maternal grandmother had pancreatitis; and the maternal grandfather had hypertension.
medical_history.social_history: The patient lives with his parents in an urban area of New England. No other specific social history factors are mentioned.
